intro: Ruellia elliptica, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of blue or purple flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Ruellia elliptica is a member of the Acanthaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. Its rapid growth and adaptability make it a popular choice for gardeners seeking a low-maintenance, shade-tolerant plant.
